email.subject: CfP - 2nd International Conference on Engineering Digital Twins

conference.name: 2nd International Conference on Engineering Digital Twins
conference.scope: Digital Twins (DTs) have emerged as a key approach to understand, monitor, and improve systems across various domains including agriculture, automotive, avionics, construction, healthcare, manufacturing, and smart cities. DT development is inherently multi-disciplinary and requires the integration of data, models, simulation, software engineering, and domain knowledge. Despite increasing adoption, DT engineering is still often ad hoc, lacking systematic concepts, methods, and tools. EDTconf 2025 aims to bring together researchers and practitioners from academia and industry to shape the future of engineering DTs in a systematic, scalable, and principled way.
topics: Modeling concepts and languages, methods, and tools for developing DTs
Quality assurance for and evaluation of DTs
DT modeling, simulation, and co-simulation of CPS
Model consistency, management, and evolution of engineering models and DT models
DTs for continuous learning and improvement
Combining models and data in DTs
Case studies, experience reports, comparisons in various application domains
Empirical studies of DT development and use
Teaching and education of DT skills

regular_papers.description: Novel research contributions with substantive evaluation.

vision_new_ideas_papers.description: Innovative and forward-looking ideas which may not yet be full developed or evaluated.

tool_demonstration_papers.description: Practical insights and tools; include appendix with demo outline.

exemplar_papers.description: Engineering-focused implementations or specs of DTs in certain domains.

notes: Papers must be original and not under review elsewhere.

journal_opportunity.description: Authors of selected regular papers will be invited to submit extended versions to the Journal on Software and Systems Modeling (SoSyM), with at least 30% new material required.
